definition: guide dog (for the blind)/Seeing Eye dog
to transmit/to lead/to guide/to conduct/to direct
blind
dog/Kangxi radical 94

sentences.english: Novels such as Lazarillo de Tormes were influential across Europe.
sentences.chinese: 託梅斯的導盲犬等小說的影響遍佈了整個歐洲。

sentences.english: We at the PSDS have a phrase ‘Guide Dogs for the Mind.’
sentences.chinese: 我們協會有個說法“心靈導盲犬”。

sentences.english: How can a dog handle such a heavy responsibility?
sentences.chinese: 導盲犬是怎麼能處理這些重大責任的？

sentences.english: The seeing-eye dog guided the blind woman across the street.
sentences.chinese: 導盲犬引這這位忙人婦女過街。

sentences.english: But how does a blind person without an eyes-seeing dog live a normal life?
sentences.chinese: 但是沒有導盲犬的盲人怎麼正常地生活呢？

sentences.english: It provided special seats for people with disabilities in all trains and allowed guide dogs to board trains.
sentences.chinese: 在所有列車設置殘疾人專座，允許導盲犬乘坐火車。

sentences.english: It may be our most direct throwback to the earliest community.
sentences.chinese: 使用導盲犬也許是人類最爲直接了當的返祖現象。

sentences.english: It's unnecessary for the blind to get that extremely expensive eyes-seeing dog.
sentences.chinese: 那盲人就不用買那種特別貴的導盲犬了。

sentences.english: Jenny is a guide dog for a blind Beijing woman named Chen Yan.
sentences.chinese: 珍妮是來自北京的盲人陳燕女士的導盲犬。

sentences.english: A guide dog can lead its blind owner.
sentences.chinese: 導盲犬可以爲盲主人引路。

sentences.english: The guy with the Chihuahua says, "You don't understand. This is my seeing-eye dog."
sentences.chinese: 牽吉娃娃的說，“你不知道，這是我的導盲犬。

sentences.english: One day a seeing-eye dog and a blind man got on a bus together.
sentences.chinese: 有一天，一個導盲犬和盲人一起了一輛公共汽車上。

sentences.english: It is a handsome guiding dog.
sentences.chinese: 那是一隻英俊的導盲犬。

definition: (Tw) medical checkup/physical examination (abbr. for 健康檢查|健康检查[jian4 kang1 jian3 cha2])
to love Hong Kong (usually implying that one also supports the PRC government)
fears of trouble in the rear (idiom); family worries (obstructing freedom of action)/worries about the future consequences/often in negative expressions, meaning "no worries about anything"
it is everyone's duty
care/treatment (e.g. nursing care)/to look after
see 體格檢查|体格检查[ti3 ge2 jian3 cha2]
"left-behind children", rural children whose parents have to make a living as migrant workers in distant urban areas, but cannot afford to keep the family with them
(pay a) return visit
exhibition match
to take in and care for (an elderly person, a dog etc)/to adopt (a child)/adoption
to place in the care of sb (a child, pet etc)/to foster/to board out
Scout (youth organization)
child soldiers/juvenile militia
social activity
to put forward plans and ideas (also derogatory)/to give advice (idiom)
highest common factor HCF/greatest common divisor GCD
(Tw) to draw on (others' experience)/to learn from (how others do things)/lesson to be learned (by observing others)
